metadata.synopsis: Dialogue with the ghost of Amelyssan, bound to eternal service to Bhaal in her afterlife. In "Baldur's Gate 2: Throne of Bhaal", she attempted to usurp Bhaal's portfolio of murder and absorb Bhaal's essence. Now she is no more than a spectral slave.
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Start the Baptism of Blood ("oe MT_Baptism" or debugbook options)- Talk to Amelyssan in the abattoir.- If you complete the baptism and become an Unholy Assassin, she will have more to say.

7.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
7.text: Welcome, Unholy Assassin. You stand among common killers, children of Murder, and would-be gods. Auspicious company indeed.

47.speaker: Player
47.text: So which are you? Common killer, child of Murder, or would-be god?

22.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
22.text: I tricked the first, devoured the second - all in pursuit of the third. Godhood.

70.speaker: Player
70.text: Does that make you a victim of such slaughter?

43.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
43.text: I know my place. I have spent much time pondering it.

2.speaker: Player
2.text: Common killers? Bhaal ought not consort with anyone but his own elect Spawn.

52.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
52.text: You are all blood-blind butchers, and have forgotten how to meditate on your murders.

11.speaker: Player
11.text: Bhaal should not consort with common murderers. They're beneath him.

1.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
1.text: What makes you any better? The vast swathes butchered in your wake?

41.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
41.text: Tell me - do any of them feel as good as your first kill?

6.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
6.text: But it wanes compared to the first. I have spent much time contemplating this.

27.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
27.text: I am Amelyssan the Blackhearted. I stood as Bhaal's high priestess - his eternal succour. Until I sought to usurp him.

10.speaker: Player
10.text: The Bhaalists made a memorial of your death.

34.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
34.text: To die among the stars, in the Astral Plane. It was a fine death. Perhaps the best.

24.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
24.text: Tell me, Bhaalspawn. How do you wish to die?

18.speaker: Player
18.text: When I am the last creature alive in a dead world, then I will slit my own throat.

71.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
71.text: You really are the most perfect of his children yet born.

57.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
57.text: You know there is no being alive Bhaal will not claim. The ultimate victory in his war is to strike the last killing blow ever to be struck.

49.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
49.text: A sorry thing, there will be no audience left for your finale.

32.speaker: Player
32.text: It will be in Father's Temple, with him watching.

3.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
3.text: Perhaps you shall soon receive what you most desire.

25.speaker: Player
25.text: Of old age, with my loved ones all around me, in bed.

38.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
38.text: You mock death? Know that somewhere in the filthy air you breathe, Lord Bhaal is always laughing. And he laughs at you.

61.speaker: Player
61.text: I need not. My beloved has the key to immortality.

9.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
9.text: One night, in thousands of years, you shall watch the stars collapse in the heavens in each other's arms, and be broiled to the bone.

40.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
40.text: Then Lord Bhaal shall claim what was long overdue.

29.speaker: Player
29.text: It's not something I think about.

26.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
26.text: I spent my life preparing for myself a death that none could look away from. The very Gods, ALL OF THEM, were forced to watch my fall at the Mana Forge.

63.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
63.text: Every time you kill, every time a life gives up in disgrace afore your eyes, you must imagine how you will die better.

44.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
44.text: You should hope for a fraction of the honour.

51.speaker: Player
51.text: 'His eternal succour'? Did you graft Spawn with him?

56.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
56.text: Such a question Sarevok must ask me thrice a year. He deludes himself with suspicions of living Spawn from my womb. There are none.

13.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
13.text: For devotees of death, you of his line are so basely fascinated with propagating new life. It ever seemed to me an impurity in the doctrine.

74.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
74.text: It was my triumph to die among the stars, in the Astral Plane. It was a fine death. Perhaps the best.

8.speaker: Player
8.text: Why would Bhaal keep around one of his foes?

72.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
72.text: Sarevok and the tainted faithful see it as an honour to serve Bhaal even in death. He knows to me, it is a slave-sentence.

37.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
37.text: The Lord of Murder did not take kindly to betrayal.

20.speaker: Player
20.text: Bhaal seems to attract a lot of usurpers as followers.

68.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
68.text: Ambition is our curse. We have no choice - murder begets it. Always.

21.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
21.text: Go, Unholy Assassin. Walk in blood, enjoy Bhaal's favour. But never lose sight of that first, perfect murder.

62.speaker: Player
62.text: And now you're a ghost who lives under a tombstone shop.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I'm guessing the challenge met with failure.

60.speaker: Player
60.text: My favourite kill was that of mine own dearest.

42.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
42.text: A mere crime of passion. You must kill without prejudice, without distinction, without reason. Death without motive is truth.

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I take no pleasure in killing. It is merely a tool.

53.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
53.text: Ah - but a tool to what end?

17.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
17.text: To kill once is to taste godhood. Every kill thereafter is an attempt to sup that ecstasy again.

45.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
45.text: Learn this, and you may yet strive for such heightened deaths as mine.
45.context: NodeContext: smug - her death was incredibly flashy

73.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
73.text: Exactly. That is why our ambition kills us all, in the end.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: I don't care for your questions.

75.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
75.text: Arrogant indeed. Very well - walk in blood, Unholy Assassin. But tread lightly.

14.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
14.text: You have found your way to the Murder Tribunal - Bhaal's favour is yours to grasp.

31.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
31.text: You reek of his blood. You snivel here looking for scab-scrapings of his favour. Snivel well, murder-whelp.

46.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
46.text: I consumed many Bhaalspawn in my life, their essence my spellfodder. If I lived yet, you would be eaten.

55.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
55.text: I wish you good slaughter, Unholy Assassin. Delight in it - while you still can.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: You are mistaken. I would be the one to eat you.

19.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
19.text: Leave me, little Bhaal-stain. Cast your perversions elsewhere, while I meditate on pure, perfect, death.

64.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
64.text: Hail, Unholy Assassin. You have fulfilled a fraction of your blood's dark promise.

50.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
50.text: You are learning it takes more than birth-blood alone to become a consecrated killer. It takes belief.

12.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
12.text: It was known to those who walked this path before you - common killers, children of Murder, and would-be gods. And now it is known to you.
